definitions.definition: Of the essence or essential element of a thing.

subdefinitions.definition: Constituting the substance of content rather than its style, and thus always nontrivial .
examples: Substantive editing is never trivial, whereas some aspects of copyediting are trivial.
substantive changes made by the lawyers

definitions.definition: Having substance ; enduring; solid ; firm; substantial .
Applying to essential legal principles and rules of right.
Not needing the use of a mordant to be made fast to that which is being dyed.
Of or pertaining to a substantive .
Actually and legally held, as distinct from an acting , temporary or honorary rank or appointment
definitions.label_groups: military , of a rank or appointment

main_definition: Of the essence or essential element of a thing.
secondary_definitions: Having substance ; enduring; solid ; firm; substantial .
( law ) Applying to essential legal principles and rules of right.
( chemistry , of a dye ) Not needing the use of a mordant to be made fast to that which is being dyed.
( grammar ) Of or pertaining to a substantive .
( military , of a rank or appointment ) Actually and legally held, as distinct from an acting , temporary or honorary rank or appointment
